page.title: 01The Village,Wool
page.content: Wool has everything a village needs;a little stream,pleasant streets with thatched cottages,modern amenities and friendly people who enjoy living in the countryside,yet who can take the train to London for a day out if they choose. Ducks roam the High Street,sometimes holding up the traffic.The stream, rising from a spring at the watercress beds,flows quietly on to Wareham and Poole Harbour. Over the past few years housing estates have been built and the population has grown. A new doctors' surgery has been built and a village hall. Wool Church of England School is taking part in the Domesday Project.We hope that in 900 years time Wool will still be a nice place in which to live.
